required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Navigator vs Standard Needle Injection for Hip
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Navigator vs Standard Needle Injection for Hip

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this randomized, parallel-group, single-blinded, single center, Phase II study is to collect data to compare the comfort and patient satisfaction of a hip injection delivered via the Navigator compared to a standard needle injection. In addition, delivery preparation will be compared between a Navigator injection and a standard hip injection. The data collected from this pilot study will serve as the basis to design a larger multi-center study.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Injection Pain as measured by VAS for both treatment groups

arm_group.description: 2cc of Celestone and 5cc of Lidocaine will be administered by the nurse or surgeon
2cc of Celestone and 5cc of Lidocaine will be administered using the Navigator by the nurse or surgeon
